page.title: 06SHOPPING AND EMPLOYMENT
page.content: As this is a rural area, the local people have to{travel out of the area for shops, schools and often work. Most of them depend on road transport, mainly private cars, despite the rail and bus services. There are{no shops}within the survey area except for a Newsagent's shop within the airport building. As a result even daily items have to be bought in the local villages or nearby towns. The farms employ few additional workers,often only one person and even then mostly part-time. The only other permanent employment is at the chemical works, the airport or at the many new uses of the RAF buildings within the airport grounds. These attract{many workers from outside the {survey area.
